meanings.sent1: He kept reviolating the rules even after being warned.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was caught reviolating the terms of his probation.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to enjoy reviolating the no-entry sign in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her actions were like reviolating a sacred trust.
meanings.sent5: The image of him reviolating the boundaries stayed in her mind.

meanings.definition: The act of violating again or repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The reviolating of the agreement led to severe consequences.
meanings.sent2: She was accused of reviolating the company's policies.
meanings.sent3: The reviolating of the peace treaty caused chaos in the region.
meanings.sent4: The constant reviolating of boundaries strained their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The repeated reviolating of trust shattered their friendship.
